body:
Couple more things:

  • for int21h to perform output, you need to set AH to 9. You're already using AX to store the loop limit; you'd have to use some other register (BX is currently unused), or a memory variable. Also, int21h function 9 changes the value of AL on output - one more reason not to use AX.
  • The string needs to be terminated with the $ character.
  • and, like obe said, you want the int 21h command before, not after the "jmp re" line.
  • at the "fin" label, you might want to quit the program. The sequence for that is: "mov ah, 4ch/int 21h"
title: display message many time in Assembly language
